casebody.data:
CHERNEY
v.
NC ZOOLOGICAL PARK. No. 606A04. Supreme Court of North Carolina. December 22, 2004. Joe Thomas Knott, III, Raleigh, for Tinya Cherney. William H. Borden, Assistant Attorney General, for N.C. Zoological Park.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 22nd day of December 2004 by Plaintiff for Extension of Time to File Brief:

"Motion Allowed. Plaintiff (Tinya Cherney) shall have up to and including the 2nd day of February 2005 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court. By order of the Court in conference this the 22nd day of December 2004."

*552
